result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela Yvette Grace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. With credit for SEVEN (7) DAYS time served. Huber privileges for treatment and work.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 07-07-2022 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

*NO CONTACT with Lashon Grace.
*NO CONTACT with NEQUANN TERRY.

*Co-operate with counselor (INGER C. or her surrogate).
*Make ALL appointments with counselor unless legitimate reason.
*Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
*Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
*Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9). Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela Yvette Grace

records.addlTxt: DISCHARGE - REGULAR.  Filed, sdg.
Filed, sdg.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Inger C. appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by:  INGER C.

Defendant sentenced to serve ONE (1) YEAR in the House of Correction with credit for SEVEN (7) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for treatment and work.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.  Consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Co-operate with counselor (INGER C. or her surrogate).
* Make ALL appointments with counselor unless legitimate reason.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* NO CONTACT with Lashon Grace.
* NO CONTACT with NEQUANN TERRY.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 07-07-2022 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Ineligible Voting, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  COURT VACATES THE 12-16-2015 JURY TRIAL BEFORE BRANCH 17.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant has been accepted into DTC.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement/DTC hearing calendared for 12-09-2015 at 10:00am.  sdg

Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Off the record discussion. Final pretrial held. Defense counsel informs the court case may have a possible resolution of drug treatment court. 12-07-2015 by 5:00 PM is the last day court will accept plea negotiations. Defense counsel to file plea forms or any resolutions should be attached with written notice. No pending issues remain. Parties to have any written stipulations submitted to the court no later than 12-16-2015 at 9:00 am. Jury trial remains scheduled for 12-16-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Case adjourned for jury trial, branch 17.

Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Angela Yvette Grace in custody.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
